node.title: whether there is a Normalization operator that can fix my total power at a certain value
node.bodyText: I want to obtain power data from an exodus file through SolutionUserObject for another simulation of thermal expansion. Since the power is a MONOMIAL variable, when the volume of an element becomes larger, the power represented by this element will also become larger. So I want to know whether there is a Normalization operator that can fix my total power at a certain value
There s a NormalizationAux you can use. A parsedAux will also work with a postprocessor computing the norm

Can one AuxVariable use two AuxKernels? Because power needs to use SolutionAux to obtain the power distribution in the exodus file.
[AuxVariables]
  [power]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = FIRST
  []
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [power_auxk]
    type = SolutionAux
    variable = power
    solution = power_uo
  []
[]

[UserObjects]
  [power_uo]
    type = SolutionUserObject
    mesh = initial.e
    system_variables = power
    timestep = LATEST
    execute_on = INITIAL
  []
[]

In this case, can power use NormalizationAux for normalization?
Just use two variables to be safe
But yeah we can on paper we just have to be careful to order them properly so it might be disallowed

It's okay to have multiple AuxKernels operating on the same AuxVariable as long as they do not overlap in space (subdomains) or in time (execute_on).
I'd think carefully about this statement "Since the power is a MONOMIAL variable, when the volume of an element becomes larger, the power represented by this element will also become larger". The power density is a volumetric quantity, it is independent of the element size unless you integrate it in space.
He's in the right for 2. If you keep the same power density in an element but grow the element you are increasing power for no good reason.

Actually using a full domain renormalization might not be the best way to do this.
I think we would rather normalize element by element, to make sure the power in each element stays the same

node.title: import results
node.bodyText:
Hello moose community,
I would like to model impact of solid1 on solid2. I have meshed with abaqus both and got some problems because, looks like, having two parts in a mesh does not work in moose. So I am trying to make an elastic analysis with a single part mesh composed of two ELSETs (solid1 and solid2). After a first elastic computation, in the second part of this work, I would like to import displacements but considering exclusively the solid2 elset  during all the new analysis. In fact, solid1 models the impactor that is not needed in the second analysis.
thank you for any help.
Regards,
Sab

Hello
What do you mean by having two parts in a mesh does not work in MOOSE?
Do you mean that the Abaqus mesh does not load in MOOSE?
Guillaume

Hi,
I remembrement receiving a message saying (almost) that a problem is raised
by libmesh because the mesh is composed of two parts. I think I will try
without impactor, just an imposed displacement on the zone of impact, this
will avoid dealing with contact problems which are not the main concern in
our analysis.

Thanks for reply,
Regards

Le ven. 30 déc. 2022, 14:13, Guillaume Giudicelli ***@***.***>
a écrit :
…
 Hello

 What do you mean by having two parts in a mesh does not work in MOOSE?
 Do you mean that the Abaqus mesh does not load in MOOSE?

 Guillaume

 —
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#23040 (comment)>,
 or unsubscribe
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFBUGDGSJ2NKXNLRCA2HI6LWP3NWJANCNFSM6AAAAAATL7W664>
 .
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
 ***@***.***>
@jwpeterson do you know of plans to support multi-parts from Abaqus? Out of curiosity, @selarem has found a workaround

node.title: WARN| MPI had an error

I want to use FSP in eigenvalue calculation and the splitting type is multiplicative. When I put pressure, velocity, T_solid, T_fluid in one splitting block, it works well:
    [pvt]
      vars = 'p velocity Ts Tf'
      petsc_options = '-ksp_monitor'
      petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_shift_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_type'
      petsc_options_value = 'lu       NONZERO               superlu_dist'
    []

But when I split them into three blocks
    [p]
      vars = 'p'
      petsc_options = '-ksp_monitor'
      petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_shift_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_type'
      petsc_options_value = 'lu       NONZERO               superlu_dist'

internal_Alltoallv(88).: Negative count, value is -4422
------------------------------------------------

I use eight core parallel computing.

Hello
Seems like a bug. We ll need a minimal non-working example to look at it
Just out of curiosity, can you please try

in serial
'Ts Tf p' and 'velocity'. They should be the same size matrices right? (in 3D)

Guillaume

We ll need a minimal non-working example to look at it

I'm glad to provide my input file, but it needed to be run in Moltres. I'm not confident that I can reproduce a similar problem only with moose but I can make my problem smaller for you to test.

in serial

When I run it in serial, it reports this at the beginning of the simulation:
Stack frames: 13
0: libMesh::print_trace(std::ostream&)
1: void moose::internal::mooseDeprecatedStream<libMesh::BasicOStreamProxy<char, std::char_traits<char> >, char const (&) [97]>(libMesh::BasicOStreamProxy<char, std::char_traits<char> >&, bool, char const (&) [97])
2: AddVariableAction::determineType[abi:cxx11](libMesh::FEType const&, unsigned int, bool)
3: VariableNotAMooseObjectAction::addVariable(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)
4: NtAction::act()
5: Action::timedAct()
6: ActionWarehouse::executeActionsWithAction(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)
7: ActionWarehouse::executeAllActions()
8: MooseApp::runInputFile()
9: MooseApp::run()
10: main
11: __libc_start_main
12: /home/jixu/projects/moltres/moltres-opt(+0x33ef) [0x7f9961f013ef]

Then the second power iteration suddenly fails to converge. I see that the residual error has been decreasing, and I don't know why it is suddenly judged as non-convergence.

'Ts Tf p' and 'velocity'. They should be the same size matrices right? (in 3D)

I use the following splitting blocks to run in 8-cores:
    [pt]
      vars = 'p Ts Tf'
      petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_shift_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_type'
      petsc_options_value = 'lu       NONZERO               superlu_dist'
    []
    [v]
      vars = 'velocity'
      petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_shift_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_type'
      petsc_options_value = 'lu       NONZERO               superlu_dist'
    []

The terminal reports that:
===================================================================================
=   BAD TERMINATION OF ONE OF YOUR APPLICATION PROCESSES
=   PID 29838 RUNNING AT DESKTOP-9HFBUBM
=   EXIT CODE: 139
=   CLEANING UP REMAINING PROCESSES
=   YOU CAN IGNORE THE BELOW CLEANUP MESSAGES
===================================================================================
YOUR APPLICATION TERMINATED WITH THE EXIT STRING: Segmentation fault (signal 11)
This typically refers to a problem with your application.
Please see the FAQ page for debugging suggestions

Suddenly judged as non convergence in serial makes me think the line search is declaring that.
Can you turn it off? or is it off already?
I have already used line_search = none to turn it off

ok then you may add more verbose flag to petsc to get more info.
wrt to a MWE in moltres, I think that will be ok since moltres is open source
the important part is that it should be as minimal as possible
I will try to reduce the scale of this problem tomorrow. But I'm afraid the problem will still be big in the end. Because it has so many variables, there are about 17 variables.
Any luck with that?
I failed to make a small non-working example to reproduce this problem. Fortunately, I am now bypassing this issue. If I encounter similar problems later, I will inform you.

node.title: Porosity Calculation during the simulation
node.bodyText:
Hello MOOSE experts,
I have a porous microstructure which is expanding and contracting during the simulation.
I want to track its average porosity change. Can you please suggest me an example to do so?
I shall be very thankful.
Best,
Avtar

Hello
So you already have the simulation and just need to measure the change?
What is porosity in your simulation? A material property? An auxvariable? Or is it not computed currently
Guillaume

Hello Guillaume,
I have porous microstructure (Solid material with voids). Currently, I am not computing the porosity parameter.
Basically, I want to track the change in porosity upon swelling and contraction process that I am doing through lithiation and delithiation phenomena.
Any suggestions?
Best,
Avtar
@jiangwen84 @sapitts on modeling a porous microstructure

Thanks,
I could do it through total volume expansion of mesh elements which I can calculate through volume postprocessor and then substracting from the total volume bound as I am working on cube. But the cube distorts a lot during the swelling and contraction makes it difficult to work through that route.
Best,
Avtar

node.title: Non convergence in Tensor Mechanics and Heat Conduction coupling
node.bodyText:
Hi！
I am trying to make a code using Tensor Mechanics Action to calculate the thermal expansion with a temperature transient.  When I do the simulation，the case does not converge. I found something wrong with the mesh as shown the below figure. If I increase the size of the mesh, the accuracy of the case  will not be reached. How can I deal with the problem.
Thanks in advance for your help!

Mao

Hello
What are seeing on this figure?
Is this a slice of a 3D mesh? Are these elements?
Guillaume
This is a slice of a 3D mesh. The shape of the mesh is rectangle.   When I do the simulation, the shape of mesh is changed. The case cannot converge.

what are the curved surfaces showing? are they cuts of elements? why are they so thin? Do they start out like this?
Deformed mesh issues are often solved by reducing the time step.
Could you please attach the (non)convergence simulation log?

what are the curved surfaces showing? are they cuts of elements? why are they so thin? Do they start out like this?
The mesh is shown as below at the beginning.  I cut elements  in the paraview. Then, I found the shape of the mesh had been changed.

Deformed mesh issues are often solved by reducing the time step.
Could you please attach the (non)convergence simulation log?
I reduce the time step, but the case still does not converge.
the (non)convergence simulation log
Time Step 8129, time = 0.00162408, dt = 1.95312e-10

Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_MAX_IT iterations 50
Solve Did NOT Converge!

**Time Step 8129, time = 0.00162408, dt = 1.95312e-10
Solve Converged!

Time Step 8130, time = 0.00162408, dt = 3.90625e-10
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_MAX_IT iterations 50
Solve Did NOT Converge!
Finished Solving                                                                       [166.16 s] [  -15 MB]
Aborting as solve did not converge
Time Step 8130, time = 0.00162408, dt = 1.95312e-10
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_MAX_IT iterations 50
Solve Did NOT Converge!
Finished Solving                                                                       [165.35 s] [  -13 MB]
Aborting as solve did not converge
Time Step 8130, time = 0.00162408, dt = 1e-10
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_MAX_IT iterations 50
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "TimeStepper", of type "ConstantDT".
Solve failed and timestep already at or below dtmin, cannot continue!
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "TimeStepper", of type "ConstantDT".
Solve failed and timestep already at or below dtmin, cannot continue!

can you print the non linear residual in Outputs
also is 1e-10 appropriate? A time step that is too small can also be an issue
The time step is 1e-7. The non linear residual in Outputs can not be printed. Because the interval is 40 in Outputs.

ok let s have a timestep slightly close to 1e-7 then.
The interval in Outputs can be removed so we can see the log
What are the executioner parameters? The linear residuals don’t decrease enough

Hello， The executioner is below.
[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = PJFNK
  petsc_options = '-snes_ksp_ew'
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-3
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-3

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_hypre_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'hypre  boomeramg '

   line_search = 'none'

  l_max_its = 100

  end_time = 6.9e-3
  dt = 1e-7
  dtmin = 1e-10
  automatic_scaling = true
[]
the non linear convergence criteria are very coarse. Especially with automatic scaling active. Can you tighten that a lot? Maybe 1e-8 instead of 1e-3

node.title: Separate boundary ids for different blocks in the mesh
node.bodyText:
Hello MOOSE Experts,
There are two materials in my mesh and I want to separate the boundary ids for both the domains.
Can you please suggest, how should I proceed?
Best,
Avtar

Hello
I think you are looking for this mesh generator
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/BreakBoundaryOnSubdomainGenerator.html
The materials are defined on different subdomains right?
Guillaume

Yes, materials are defined on different subdomains.
Thank you very much.
Best,
Avtar

node.title: Loop over all nodal values of material property in a user object
node.bodyText:
Hi All,
I am working with discrete nucleation for recrystallization and would like to prevent new grains from overlapping with existing recrystallized grains. My thought to do this was related to the nucleation probability, which is already known to DiscreteNucleationInserter and in my model it becomes 0 in recrystallized grains. So I am coding an optional loop that would check if any points inside a proposed nucleus have a 0 probability (or less than some threshold), and if so it would either eliminate the nucleus or resize its radius to not overlap, depending on user options.
What i am unsure of is how to access the value of _probability at different elements? I only ever see material property values being looped over the qp n one element. As a follow up question, if I can access any elements material property value is there a way to create a subset of elements to check. Ideally, I would only check elements that fall within a box around the proposed nucleus, and not the entire domain.
Thanks,
Floyd

Hello
There have been a few posts on grain nucleation overlap on the discussion forum. Did you have the chance to take a look?
You could block restrict the object instead of looking at the entire domain.
Guillaume

Hi @GiudGiud after looking into possible solutions what I settled on was using the RadialAverage user object. I will create a material property that is 1 in the recrystallized grains and 0 outside, then the RadialAverage user object will take that and perform a spatial averaging, such that the value is between 0 and 1 as you approach the new grain areas. In this way when a new grain is being proposed it can check that averaging map to know how close it is to an existing recrystallized grain and adjust accordingly.
I will have to modify the DiscreteNucleationInserter to access RadialAverage and then it should be straightforward to perform the checks and operations i need.

This seems like a working solution. I dont see a spatialValue() API in that user object unfortunately, that would have been the cannon way of accessing the data.
The issue I think is that this UO only computes a single average, near desired coordinates, instead of the average at every location. Am I correct?

What I found is there is a RadialAverageAux kernel that calls RadialAverage for each point in the domain and stores the result in an Aux variable. So what is collected is a local average for every point in the domain. One issue is the RadialAverageAux is it is registered to the MooseTestApp, so thats an easy enough change for me to use it, but i opened an issue to have it registered to MooseApp so that others can find it and make use the RadialAverage functionality.
The NearestPointAverage UO got merged btw, which does have the spatialValue() API which you can call from your object to get local averages

node.title: reading a vtu mesh file
node.bodyText:
Hello,
Is there an example of how to read a vtu mesh file while identifying the boundaries so boundary conditions can be applied.
I can see the input example here
[Mesh]
  file = three_block.e

  # These names will be applied on the fly to the
  # mesh so that they can be used in the input file
  # In addition they will show up in the output file
  block_id = '1 2 3'
  block_name = 'wood steel copper'

  boundary_id = '1 2'
  boundary_name = 'left right'
[]

How do I get or create the block_idand boundary_id labels in a vtu file? If anyone would have a small, say 2D, vtu ASCII file available to share, I would appreciate.
Thanks,
Valmor

Try opening your .vtu file in paraview. You should be able to find your block and subdomain ids there, and those will be the same IDs MOOSE will use. If you have problems, you can run your MOOSE app with the --mesh-only flag, and output an exodus file that will definitely have the information you're looking for, which you can inspect in paraview.

Hi there, I'm facing similar issues. I'm trying to do a diffusion solve on a .vtu mesh. I am not able to run it. How should I proceed? Any help is very highly appreciated!
Thanks,
J

The VTK files consist of metadata vtm and data vtu. In the vtm file:
<VTKFile type="vtkMultiBlockDataSet" version="1.0" byte_order="LittleEndian" header_type="UInt64">
  <vtkMultiBlockDataSet>
    <Block index="0" name="Element Blocks">
      <DataSet index="0" name="Unnamed block ID: 1" file="brick.vtu"/>
    </Block>
    <Block index="4" name="Side Sets">
      <DataSet index="0" name="inflow"/>
      <DataSet index="1" name="outflow"/>
      <DataSet index="2" name="duct"/>
    </Block>
  </vtkMultiBlockDataSet>
  <FieldData>
    <DataArray type="Float64" Name="TimeValue" NumberOfTuples="1" format="ascii" RangeMin="0" RangeMax="0">
      0
    </DataArray>
  </FieldData>
</VTKFile>

I see the side sets. The actual data is in the brick.vtu file. If I run MOOSE with --mesh-only it produces an .e output with no side sets. Also, I am unable to read the vtm/vtu data directly with MOOSE. It wants a file with extension vtu. This is probably why the .e file does not have the side sets when I give MOOSE the .vtu file (no metadata). Is there a way to read xml VTK files in MOOSE and be able to access the side sets so I can enforce boundary conditions?
Thanks.

I, too, am interested in this.  I've never sidesets to work, but have never tried too hard.  We have a lot of scripts that generate vtk files, and i end up converting to exodus and spending plenty of time defining sidesets.  If anyone has a recipe to follow regarding MOOSE + VTK, i'd love to hear it.

dont think vtu is supported but vtk is
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/FileMeshGenerator.html
meshio is a great one for converting between formats btw, and cubit can do a few conversions too

node.title: Question about running a program
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I'm new to moose. I ran into problems while running the program. I received the following error message. How to solve this problem？Thanks!
Linking Executable /Users/liunan/projects/article3/stork-opt...
Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
  "StorkTestApp::registerApps()", referenced from:
      _main in main.x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0.opt.o
ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
clang-12: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
make: *** [/Users/liunan/projects/moose/framework/app.mk:416: /Users/liunan/projects/article3/stork-opt] Error 1

Hello
Did you modify the files after creating a new app?
This looks like the includes are present in the folder, but some of the source got deleted
Did you call your app stork?
Guillaume

Hi @GiudGiud ,
Thank you for your reply.
The process of creating an application is attached as follows. I wonder whether this process causes some of the sources to get deleted.
All the best,
Nan Liu

Hello
'
You are right the process definitely failed.
Can you try running it from the projects folder
so:
./moose/scripts/stork.sh new_cat
Guillaume

Hello @GiudGiud ,
Thank you for your response.
Running "./moose/scripts/stork.sh new_cat" from the projects folder doesn't work. I have no idea why this error is appearing.
Best,
Nan Liu

The script says why.
projects is a git directory. That s not normal
you should wipe the directory and try again
Please do not post pictures of Text as well. Doing so makes it impossible to use the search feature. You started off just fine in your original post :) Not sure what made you switch to pictures!

node.title: Issues about SideDiffusiveFluxIntegral postprocessor
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I ran a simple steady-state heat conduction problem with a circular cylindrical shell model, heat source set to 21.057 W/cm3 (volume of the model is 47.5 cm3, so total power is 1000 W).
The top, bottom and outer surfaces of the model were set as adiabatic boundary conditions, and the inner surfaces were set as temperature Dirichlet boundary.
I added SideDiffusiveFluxIntegral postprocessor on both inner and outer boundary, and I think theoretically the former should be equal to the total power, e.g. 1000, but it gives 867 (and will vary slightly with given boundary temperature), and the latter gives -122.
Does anyone have a clue about this?
Here is my input
[Mesh]
  [file]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = simp.e
  []
[]

[Variables]
  [temp]
  []
[]

[Kernels]
  [hc]
    type = HeatConduction
    variable = temp
  []
  [heat]
    type = HeatSource
    variable = temp
    value = 21.052
  []
[]

[BCs]
  [heat_pipe_wall_temp]
    type = DirichletBC
    boundary = 'inner'
    variable = temp
    value = 900
  []
  [adiabatic_surface]
    type = NeumannBC
    boundary = 'top bottom outer'
    variable = temp
  []
[]

[Materials]
  [k_fuel]
    type = ParsedMaterial
    args = 'temp'
    block = 'heater'
    f_name = thermal_conductivity
    function = '(12.17+0.038*(temp-273.15))/100'
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-8
  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_hypre_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'hypre boomeramg'
  steady_state_detection = true
  steady_state_tolerance = 1e-08
[]

[Postprocessors]
  [flux_integral_inner]
    type = SideDiffusiveFluxIntegral
    boundary = 'inner'
    variable = temp
    diffusivity = 'thermal_conductivity'
  []
  [flux_integral_outer]
    type = SideDiffusiveFluxIntegral
    boundary = 'outer'
    variable = temp
    diffusivity = 'thermal_conductivity'
  []
  [max_T]
    type = NodalExtremeValue
    variable = temp
  []
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
  print_linear_residuals = false
[]

Hello
It seems odd to have a non zero flux with a Neumann BC of 0.
Is the result converged? Can you please attach the output log
Does this get better with mesh refinement?
Guillaume

Ah...I didn't realize it was the mesh which lead to this problem before.
I refine the mesh and the result seems better.
Thanks for your guidance Guillaume,  Sorry for taking up your time for this minor problem
no worries
